trans-unit.source: A "LAMP" stack is a group of open source software that is typically installed together to enable a server to host dynamic websites and web applications.
trans-unit.target: A "LAMP" stack is a group of open source software that is typically installed together to enable a server to host dynamic websites and web applications.

trans-unit.source: This term is actually an acronym that represents the Linux operating system with the Apache web server.
trans-unit.target: This term is actually an acronym that represents the Linux operating system with the Apache web server.

trans-unit.source: The site data is stored in a MySQL database, and dynamic content is processed by PHP.
trans-unit.target: The site data is stored in a MySQL database, and dynamic content is processed by PHP.

trans-unit.source: In this guide, we'll get a LAMP stack installed on a Linux image and deploy it on Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: In this guide, we'll get a LAMP stack installed on a Linux image and deploy it on Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Generate an SSH Authentication Key
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Generate an SSH Authentication Key

trans-unit.source: SSH is an important tool for system administrators.
trans-unit.target: SSH is an important tool for system administrators.

trans-unit.source: However, relying on a human-determined password for security is not always wise.
trans-unit.target: However, relying on a human-determined password for security is not always wise.

trans-unit.source: A strong SSH key allows you to leave remote access open without worrying about passwords.
trans-unit.target: A strong SSH key allows you to leave remote access open without worrying about passwords.

trans-unit.source: The method consists of authentication with asymmetric cryptography.
trans-unit.target: The method consists of authentication with asymmetric cryptography.

trans-unit.source: The user’s private key is the one that grants the authentication.
trans-unit.target: The user’s private key is the one that grants the authentication.

trans-unit.source: You can even lock the user’s account to disallow password authentication completely.
trans-unit.target: You can even lock the user’s account to disallow password authentication completely.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to generate the SSH Authentication Key.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to generate the SSH Authentication Key.

trans-unit.source: Download and install puttygen from the following location: [http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/](http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/)putty/download.html
trans-unit.target: Download and install puttygen from the following location: [http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/](http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/)putty/download.html

trans-unit.source: Run puttygen.exe.
trans-unit.target: Run puttygen.exe.

trans-unit.source: Click **Generate** to generate the keys.
trans-unit.target: Click **Generate** to generate the keys.

trans-unit.source: In the process you can increase randomness by moving the mouse over the blank area in the window.
trans-unit.target: In the process you can increase randomness by moving the mouse over the blank area in the window.

trans-unit.source: After the generate process, Puttygen.exe will show your generated key.
trans-unit.target: After the generate process, Puttygen.exe will show your generated key.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Select and copy the public key in **Key** and save it in a file named **publicKey.pem**.
trans-unit.target: Select and copy the public key in **Key** and save it in a file named **publicKey.pem**.

trans-unit.source: Don’t click **Save public key**, because the saved public key’s file format is different from the public key we want.
trans-unit.target: Don’t click **Save public key**, because the saved public key’s file format is different from the public key we want.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save private key** and save it in a file named **privateKey.ppk**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save private key** and save it in a file named **privateKey.ppk**.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Open the HTTP port to allow web access
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Open the HTTP port to allow web access

trans-unit.source: Endpoints in Azure consists of a protocol (TCP or UDP), along with a public and private port.
trans-unit.target: Endpoints in Azure consists of a protocol (TCP or UDP), along with a public and private port.

trans-unit.source: The private port is the port that the service is listening on the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The private port is the port that the service is listening on the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The public port is the port that the Azure cloud service is listening externally for Internet-based traffic.
trans-unit.target: The public port is the port that the Azure cloud service is listening externally for Internet-based traffic.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, this is the same port number.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, this is the same port number.

trans-unit.source: TCP port 80 is the default port number on which Apache listens.
trans-unit.target: TCP port 80 is the default port number on which Apache listens.

trans-unit.source: Opening this port with an Azure endpoint will allow you and other Internet clients access to the Apache web server.
trans-unit.target: Opening this port with an Azure endpoint will allow you and other Internet clients access to the Apache web server.

trans-unit.target: By default, HTTP traffic uses port 80.

trans-unit.target: Can't access Virtual Machine with Apache and Moodle from the Internet

trans-unit.source: **Symptom**
trans-unit.target: **Symptom**

trans-unit.source: Apache is running but you can’t see the Apache default page with your browser.
trans-unit.target: Apache is running but you can’t see the Apache default page with your browser.

trans-unit.source: Possible root case
trans-unit.target: Possible root case

trans-unit.source: The Apache listening port is not same as the Private Port of your virtual machine's endpoint for web traffic.
trans-unit.target: The Apache listening port is not same as the Private Port of your virtual machine's endpoint for web traffic.

trans-unit.source: Check your Public Port and Private Port endpoint settings and make sure the Private Port is same as the Apache listen port.
trans-unit.target: Check your Public Port and Private Port endpoint settings and make sure the Private Port is same as the Apache listen port.

trans-unit.source: See Phase 1: Create an Image for instructions on configuring endpoints for your virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: See Phase 1: Create an Image for instructions on configuring endpoints for your virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: To determine the listen port of Apache, open /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf (Red Hat release) or /etc/apache2/ports.conf (Debian release), search for the string “Listen”.
trans-unit.target: To determine the listen port of Apache, open /etc/httpd/conf/httpd.conf (Red Hat release) or /etc/apache2/ports.conf (Debian release), search for the string “Listen”.

trans-unit.source: The default port is 80.
trans-unit.target: The default port is 80.

trans-unit.source: The firewall has disabled the listen port of Apache.
trans-unit.target: The firewall has disabled the listen port of Apache.

trans-unit.source: If you can see Apache default page from the local host, then the problem is most likely that the port which is listened by Apache is blocked by the firewall.
trans-unit.target: If you can see Apache default page from the local host, then the problem is most likely that the port which is listened by Apache is blocked by the firewall.
